title.narrative: Share-Net Bangladesh

description.narrative: Share-Net Bangladesh is the country hub of Share-Net International, a Knowledge Platform focusing on Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights (SRHR). Share-Net Bangladesh is the first of Share-Net International’s country hub, drawing on the years of experiences and interventions by practitioners, researchers, and policymakers in the field of sexual reproductive health, especially placing SRHR at the centre of human rights. Share-Net Bangladesh aims to bring together the Communities of Practice (CoP) that consist of social and medical researchers, development practitioners, health workers, government officials and legal experts to engage with one another to find solutions and take critical issues forward. Share-Net Bangladesh is hosted by RedOrange Media and Communications. Priorities of Share-Net Bangladesh: * Promote interaction between the national, international, sustainable and empowered community of practice and encourage them to share learning. * To apply the knowledge to evidence-informed SRHR programs, policies and practices. * Enable the members and the strategic partners to connect, discuss, share, translate and jointly operate this knowledge network on SRHR. * Ensure the accessibility of the policymakers, practitioners and researchers to the knowledge platform and enable them to address the relevant knowledge gaps on SRHR scientifically, politically and practically

title.narrative: The network of Share-Net country hubs is connected and promotes the jointly developed SRHR knowledge agenda

description.narrative: Cross-country learning

comment.narrative: We planned to follow 1 SRHR and SBCC training

Monthly Capacity Building sessions organized by host organisation RedOrange Media and Communications help all its employees including the Share-Net Bangladesh team members gather and share knowledge on different topics related to SRHR. Every month the team discuss, share and participate in group exercises together and share about their opinions, perspectives, and experiences to have practical learning as well as have the proper understanding of the contexts. SHIRIM learning sessions in 2021 organised by Share-Net International

comment.narrative: Ms. Mushfiqua Zaman Satiar, Senior Policy Adviser- SRHR and Gender, SCS Partnership Coordinator and Youth Focal at the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands has been in good liaison with Share-Net Bangladesh. As a representative of the Embassy, she joined the meeting of the CoP on Child Marriage and provided valuable inputs regarding the Knowledge Fair. At the 6th Knowledge Fair on 21st November 2021, she joined the event as the Special guest and delivered her encouraging speech

title.narrative: Addressing priority knowledge gaps through research and further analysis and synthesis of existing data

description.narrative: Knowledge generation

title.narrative: Number of young research grants rewarded

description.narrative: Number and kind of knowledge that has been generated through SNBD

comment.narrative: We planned 2 young researcher fellowship grants awarded by SNBD

2 young research fellowship grants have been selected to produce knowledge products under the grants of Share-Net Bangladesh, the grant receivers are two youth group named 1) Mansura Islam and Sabbir Ahmed on "Perception on the event of climate change on Child Marriage in Bhola district" 2) Md. Shakhawat Hossain and Arifur Rahaman on "Nexus Between Climate-Induced Displacement And Violence against Women and Girls: Evidence From Disaster Prone Areas of Bangladesh"

title.narrative: Addressing priority knowledge gaps through research and further analysis and synthesis of existing data

description.narrative: Knowledge generation

title.narrative: Number of research products prepared

description.narrative: Number and kind of knowledge that has been generated through SNBD

comment.narrative:
4 Knowledge Products from the CoPs: Refer back to section 3.3
2 Knowledge Products under the Young Researcher Fellowship Research: Research paper on ‘Perceptions on the effect of climate change on child marriage in Bhola district: A qualitative exploration based on social-ecological model.’ Research paper on ‘Nexus Between Climate-induced Displacement and Violence against Women and Girls: Evidence from Disaster Prone Areas of Bangladesh.’
The research activity on “Strengthening communication strategies and reducing knowledge gaps to prevent human trafficking among women” the in progress from 1st December 2021 as a part of Share-Net Bangladesh 2021 deliverables. But the research has been delayed due to some unfortunate experience with the contracted researcher who canceled at the last minute. As we were already in the middle of the research, the secretariat had a meeting urgently to mitigate the risk and hired a new researcher immediately. The whole secretariat team agreed to go with a new researcher who is reputed in the human trafficking research work in Bangladesh and has previously worked with the host organization Red Orange and agreed to do the job and the final report is expected by 7th March 2022.

title.narrative: Number of knowledge products created by small grants holders

description.narrative: Number and kind of knowledge that has been translated into the appropriate formats

comment.narrative:
#ARBAN ‘Cholo Kotha Boli – youth to youth podcast’ by ARBAN. ARBAN has developed 10 episodes of SRHR related audio podcasts within the time framework. #Justicia Feminist Network ‘Dhee 2.0: Tackling forced marriages within LGBTIQ community in Bangladesh’ by Justicia Feminist Network and partner Oboyob Diversity Circle. Objectives of the project: #SERAC Bangladesh Research paper: ‘Experiences and Perceptions of mid adolescents, parents and teachers on comprehensive sexuality education: A multiple country-based qualitative research study’ #Wreetu Be Your Daughter's Superhero: A Comprehensive Period guide or Dads to Help Daughters to be Empowered with Needed Knowledge, Confidence and Self-Esteem Ensuring their Menstrual Wellbeing. Knowledge products: A booklet and a video series for dads demonstrating a friendly guideline on how, when and what to talk about period and puberty with an adolescent daughter.
Published articles are as follows: https://www.daily-sun.com/post/587174/Wreetu-inaugurate-friendly-period-guides-for-dads https://bangladeshbeyond.com.bd/wreetu-introduced-awareness-series-on-girls-puberty/

title.narrative: Number of knowledge products created by Communities of Practice

description.narrative: Number and kind of knowledge that has been translated into the appropriate formats

comment.narrative:
There were four Knowledge products produced by 3 CoPs in 2021: CoP on Child Marriage (2): Knowledge product: Infographic on Child Marriage and Climate vulnerability (Child marriage vs Climate change) Report on the ‘Mapping of the Climate Change Related Vulnerabilities and Child Marriage in Bangladesh’ CoP on Gender-based Violence (GBV) (1): Knowledge product: Fact Sheet on GBV induced by Climate Change CoP on Infertility (1): Knowledge product: Narrative Report on ‘Infertility in SRHR Lens: Policy & Practices’
Fact Sheet on GBV induced by Climate Change CoP on Infertility (1): Knowledge product: Narrative Report on ‘Infertility in SRHR Lens: Policy & Practices’

comment.narrative: On 28-29 August 2021, the Department of Population Sciences, University of Dhaka, organized the 3rd National Conference on Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights (SRHR) online on Zoom platform where the abstract of the MHM report from Share-Net Bangladesh was selected for presentation. Share-Net Bangladesh Knowledge Management Expert also joined a session titled ‘Adolescent Health, Safe Motherhood and Men Involvement’ as a discussant. Presentation on Share-Net Bangladesh at the virtual South Asia Regional SBCC Summit on 7-9th December 2021 by Nujhat Jahan Khan.

comment.narrative: We commit to organising one thematic session a year

SBCC Training for SRHR and Gender Share-Net Bangladesh organised a training program for young professionals titled ‘SBCC Training on SRHR and Gender’ on 13th and 14th December 2021 at the Royal Park Residence Hotel, Banani, Dhaka. This training program has reached 18 young people from both the urban area and the grassroots level. There was a lot of variation among the participants

title.narrative: A network of SRHR Communities of Practice is operational enabling members and strategic partners to connect; discuss and share; translate and co-create SRHR knowledge

description.narrative: Uptake of knowledge

title.narrative: Description of how CoPs on SRHR are functioning

description.narrative: Functioning of CoPs

comment.narrative: Not measured at baseline

#The survey data shows that at least one member responded from each of all the CoPs formed to date. A total of 13 members from different CoPs responded to the survey.
Members mostly agreed positively (92 to 100%) in the areas of member engagement, diversity of engagement, improvement of knowledge, skill and capacity, influencing actions taken by the CoP, respectful environment, implementation of the knowledge acquired, addressing topics from their areas of work, knowledge dissemination, quality output and outcome, the contribution of the CoP in the improvement of work, room to address challenges etc.
It was surprising to see the areas of improvement in selecting relevant topics promptly for the CoPs (as per 1 response) and member responsiveness and attendance. Almost 31% of members stood neutral in response to whether their CoP strives for high-quality outputs and outcomes. Also, it was surprising to see that CoP members (2 responses more than 15%) felt that the funding for their CoP to organize activities is not sufficient. One thing we can also work on is the dissemination of the knowledge products by the CoP members and promoting them more through our social media to ensure people outside the network (non-members) also use the knowledge that our CoP generated.
